data.title: By The Numbers: Josef Martínez’s record-breaking run in Atlanta
data.meta_description: The striker departs Atlanta United the holder of several club and MLS records.
data.text:
On Wednesday, Atlanta United announced the release of Josef MartÃ­nez, the former Golden Boot winner and Landon Donovan MLS MVP. The move marks the end of an exceptional run in Atlanta for the Venezuelan striker, a run that began with the clubâs inaugural season in 2017.

At 29 years old, MartÃ­nez departs the holder of several club and MLS records. Here are some of the many feats he accomplished during his time at Atlanta United, by the numbers:Â

111

Known as a lethal striker, MartÃ­nez leaves Atlanta as far and away the clubâs all-time leading goal scorer. In all competitions, MartÃ­nez has scored 111 goals for Atlanta United. Of those 111 goals, 103 were scored in MLS competition, including regular season and Audi MLS Cup Playoffs. This past season, he scored nine goals in 26 appearances and added four assists.

31

In 2018, the Venezuelan striker won the Golden Boot, the award given to the player who scores the most goals in the MLS regular season. That year, MartÃ­nez scored 31 goals in MLS regular season play, which broke the scoring record at the time. Then, he added four goals during the Audi MLS Cup Playoffs to bring his combined total to 35 and deliver Atlanta its first MLS Cup title.

3

Every Atlanta United supporter remembers 2018 when the club won the MLS Cup. Itâs also the year that MartÃ­nez made a name for himself in MLS. That year MartÃ­nez won not one, not two, but three MVP awards: MLS regular season, MLS All-Star and MLS Cup. Heâs the only player in league history to win three MVP awards in a single season. Add that to winning the MLS Golden Boot and MartÃ­nezâs season in 2018 ranks among one of the best for a single player in MLS history.

33

As good as the 2018 season was for MartÃ­nez, the following season went almost just as well. In 2019, the striker scored 33 goals for Atlanta United in 39 appearances across all competitions, which made him the teamâs top scorer in both MLS and Concacaf Champions League. In league play, MartÃ­nez scored 27 goals and four assists, good enough to finish third in both MVP voting and the Golden Boot race.

15

Also in 2019, MartÃ­nez went on a run and scored in 15 consecutive matches from May 14 to September 18.Â That streak is an MLS record. At the time, it also tied for the second-longest scoring streak in world soccer since MLS began play in 1996. (Only superstar and World Cup champion Lionel Messi boasted a longer streak when he scored in 21 consecutive league games for FC Barcelona from 2013-14.)

Fifteen not only indicates the number of consecutive matches that MartÃ­nez scored in. The striker also scored more than 15 goals in a single season three consecutive time (2017, 2018, 2019), a mark that puts him in elite company with just seven other MLS players.

77

Among some of MartÃ­nezâs streaks includes the most goals scored in a three-season span in MLS history. From 2017 to 2019, the striker scored a total of 77 goals.

2Â

Two of MartÃ­nezâs goals for Atlanta United won AT&T Goal of the Year. The first was in 2019 when MartÃ­nez outfoxed the FC Cincinnati defense to score in the 65th minute. Then again, the striker earned the award in 2022 with a world-class bicycle kick in the 54th minute. With those two goals, along with Tito Villalbaâs in 2017, Atlanta United earned the award three times in the clubâs six-year history.

19Â

MartÃ­nezâs career in Atlanta started at an impressive rate. The striker scored 19 goals in 17 starts in his debut season in MLS in 2017, the most ever by a player on an expansion club.Â

4

His individual awards at Atlanta United are impressive, but MartÃ­nez also helped the club win four trophies. He was part of the Atlanta United squads that won the Eastern Conference championship (2018), MLS Cup (2018), Campeones Cup (2019) and Lamar Hunt U.S. Open Cup (2019).
